alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 10:24PM CST until December 18 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Benton, Carroll, Crawford, Franklin, Madison, Sebastian and Washington AR. In Oklahoma, Adair, Cherokee, Delaware, Haskell, Latimer, Le Flore, McIntosh, Muskogee, Pittsburg and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A frontal boundary remained located just south of I-40 this evening. Strong lift along with record precipitable water values, and the continued potential for training of storms will lead to additional heavy rainfall through tonight across the watch area. Additional 1-2 inches with localized 3 inches and greater are possible. The flooding threat will begin to decrease late tonight as storms shift southeast of the region. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
